授業目的: Programming language syntax and semantics. Data types and type checking. Scope, binding, and environments. Functional and logic programming paradigms and comparison with other paradigms. The broad scope of functional languages. This course covers computer language paradigms including the principles, concepts and underlying foundations of all programming languages.
到達目標: Students will learn programming language syntax and semantics; understand data types and type checking; scope, binding, and environments; and learn to distinguish between functional and logic programming paradigms and how they compare to other paradigms. This course will give students the knowledge and hands-on experience of computer language paradigms, including the principles, concepts, and foundations of all the programming languages ​​​​​that underpin them.
特記事項: 【合併】Web Programming（総合政策学部）/ウェブ・プログラミング（総合政策学部）
授業方法:
Requires student presentations and individual and team projects.
In essence, the class format is face-to-face, but for students who have permission for online classes, the class will be taught in a simultaneous interactive online format. All classes are recorded via Zoom and can be viewed later on the Luna

site
.

トピック.授業計画1:
All 14 classes are primarily face-to-face and
include the following topics:
1. We begin with a brief survey of the main design concepts, paradigms, and history of computer.
2. We then explore the syntax, or surface structure of the language, and understand and teach exactly what this structure is.
3. We then return to the basics of computer language principles, including a survey of semantics, data type checking, and the run-time environment.
4. Using the programming language of our choice, we attempt to understand the basic concepts of each of the following computer language processing methods:
5. Data structures and variables
6. Expressions and syntax
7. Special constructs
8. Conditionals
9. Loops
10. Events
11. Recursion
12. List structures
13. Arrays
14. The object-oriented paradigm
トピック.授業外学習2: Nothing in particular.
